page.title: 03THE HAMLET OF RODHUISH
page.content: Rodhuish is a collection of farm houses and tied cottages built along the slopes of a small valley. Some of the cottages are in ruins, but others have been renovated as holiday cottages for the many tourists the area attracts. Once there was a thriving community, big enough to support the church of St Bartholomew and a Methodist Chapel. Some farms seem to have disappeared, the land taken over by neighbours and the buildings are now private owned. Hill Farm has gone altogether. There are no shops and not even a pub. Local residents either work on the land or are retired. People go to Minehead or Williton for supplies and rely on the villages of Roadwater and Withycombe for community activities. Watching television would seem to be a popular way of spending an evening.
